intro: Thlaspi microphyllum, commonly known as the dwarf cabbagewort, is a low-growing flowering plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many familiar plants like cabbages and mustards. The plant features small, rounded leaves and produces clusters of tiny, yellow flowers. It is adapted to cold climates and can thrive in rocky or sandy soils. Thlaspi microphyllum is often found in high-altitude environments where few other plants can survive.
